argument.name: electric_panel_load_other_power_rating
argument.description: Specifies the panel load other power rating. This represents the total of all other electric loads that are fastened in place, permanently connected, or located on a specific circuit. For example, garbage disposal, built-in microwave. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Service Feeders) is used.

argument.name: electric_panel_load_other_new_load
argument.description: Whether the other load is a new panel load addition to an existing service panel. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Service Feeders) is used.

argument.name: battery_present
argument.description: Whether there is a lithium ion battery present.

argument.name: battery_location
argument.description: The space type for the lithium ion battery location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Batteries) is used.

argument.name: battery_power
argument.description: The rated power output of the lithium ion battery. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Batteries) is used.

argument.name: battery_capacity
argument.description: The nominal capacity of the lithium ion battery. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Batteries) is used.

argument.name: battery_usable_capacity
argument.description: The usable capacity of the lithium ion battery. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Batteries) is used.

argument.name: battery_round_trip_efficiency
argument.description: The round trip efficiency of the lithium ion battery. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Batteries) is used.

argument.name: battery_num_bedrooms_served
argument.description: Number of bedrooms served by the lithium ion battery. Only needed if single-family attached or apartment unit and it is a shared battery serving multiple dwelling units. Used to apportion battery charging/discharging to the unit of a SFA/MF building.

argument.name: vehicle_type
argument.description: The type of vehicle present at the home.

argument.name: vehicle_battery_capacity
argument.display_name: Vehicle: EV Battery Nominal Battery Capacity
argument.description: The nominal capacity of the vehicle battery, only applies to electric vehicles. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: vehicle_battery_usable_capacity
argument.description: The usable capacity of the vehicle battery, only applies to electric vehicles. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: vehicle_fuel_economy_units
argument.description: The combined fuel economy units of the vehicle. Only 'kWh/mile', 'mile/kWh', or 'mpge' are allow for electric vehicles. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: vehicle_fuel_economy_combined
argument.description: The combined fuel economy of the vehicle. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: vehicle_miles_driven_per_year
argument.description: The annual miles the vehicle is driven. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: vehicle_hours_driven_per_week
argument.description: The weekly hours the vehicle is driven. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: vehicle_fraction_charged_home
argument.description: The fraction of charging energy provided by the at-home charger to the vehicle, only applies to electric vehicles. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: ev_charger_present
argument.description: Whether there is an electric vehicle charger present.

argument.name: ev_charger_level
argument.description: The charging level of the EV charger. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Electric Vehicle Chargers) is used.

argument.name: ev_charger_power
argument.display_name: Electric Vehicle Charger: Rated Charging Power
argument.description: The rated power output of the EV charger. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Electric Vehicle Chargers) is used.

argument.name: lighting_present
argument.description: Whether there is lighting energy use.

argument.name: lighting_interior_fraction_cfl
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (interior) that are compact fluorescent. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_interior_fraction_lfl
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (interior) that are linear fluorescent. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_interior_fraction_led
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (interior) that are light emitting diodes. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_interior_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the lighting energy usage (interior) that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Lighting) is used.

argument.name: lighting_exterior_fraction_cfl
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (exterior) that are compact fluorescent. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_exterior_fraction_lfl
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (exterior) that are linear fluorescent. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_exterior_fraction_led
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (exterior) that are light emitting diodes. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_exterior_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the lighting energy usage (exterior) that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Lighting) is used.

argument.name: lighting_garage_fraction_cfl
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (garage) that are compact fluorescent. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_garage_fraction_lfl
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (garage) that are linear fluorescent. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_garage_fraction_led
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (garage) that are light emitting diodes. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_garage_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the lighting energy usage (garage) that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Lighting) is used.

argument.name: holiday_lighting_present
argument.description: Whether there is holiday lighting.

argument.name: holiday_lighting_daily_kwh
argument.description: The daily energy consumption for holiday lighting (exterior). If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Lighting) is used.

argument.name: holiday_lighting_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Nov 25 - Jan 5'. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Lighting) is used.

argument.name: dehumidifier_type
argument.description: The type of dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_capacity
argument.description: The capacity (water removal rate) of the dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_rh_setpoint
argument.description: The relative humidity setpoint of the dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_fraction_dehumidification_load_served
argument.description: The dehumidification load served fraction of the dehumidifier.

argument.name: clothes_washer_present
argument.description: Whether there is a clothes washer present.

argument.name: clothes_washer_location
argument.description: The space type for the clothes washer location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of the clothes washer.

argument.name: clothes_washer_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the clothes washer. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_rated_annual_kwh
argument.description: The annual energy consumed by the clothes washer, as rated, obtained from the EnergyGuide label. This includes both the appliance electricity consumption and the energy required for water heating. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_label_electric_rate
argument.description: The annual energy consumed by the clothes washer, as rated, obtained from the EnergyGuide label. This includes both the appliance electricity consumption and the energy required for water heating. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_label_gas_rate
argument.description: The annual energy consumed by the clothes washer, as rated, obtained from the EnergyGuide label. This includes both the appliance electricity consumption and the energy required for water heating. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_label_annual_gas_cost
argument.display_name: Clothes Washer: Label Annual Cost with Gas DHW
argument.description: The annual cost of using the system under test conditions. Input is obtained from the EnergyGuide label. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_label_usage
argument.description: The clothes washer loads per week. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_capacity
argument.description: Volume of the washer drum. Obtained from the EnergyStar website or the manufacturer's literature. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the clothes washer energy and hot water usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_present
argument.description: Whether there is a clothes dryer present.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_location
argument.description: The space type for the clothes dryer location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Dryer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_fuel_type
argument.description: Type of fuel used by the clothes dryer.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of the clothes dryer.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the clothes dryer. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Dryer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_vented_flow_rate
argument.description: The exhaust flow rate of the vented clothes dryer. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Dryer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the clothes dryer energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Dryer) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_present
argument.description: Whether there is a dishwasher present.

argument.name: dishwasher_location
argument.description: The space type for the dishwasher location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of dishwasher.

argument.name: dishwasher_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the dishwasher. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_label_electric_rate
argument.description: The label electric rate of the dishwasher. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_label_gas_rate
argument.description: The label gas rate of the dishwasher. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_label_annual_gas_cost
argument.description: The label annual gas cost of the dishwasher. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_label_usage
argument.description: The dishwasher loads per week. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_place_setting_capacity
argument.description: The number of place settings for the unit. Data obtained from manufacturer's literature. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the dishwasher energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: refrigerator_present

argument.name: refrigerator_location
argument.description: The space type for the refrigerator location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Refrigerators) is used.

argument.name: refrigerator_rated_annual_kwh
argument.description: The EnergyGuide rated annual energy consumption for a refrigerator. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Refrigerators) is used.

argument.name: refrigerator_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the refrigerator energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Refrigerators) is used.

argument.name: extra_refrigerator_present

argument.name: extra_refrigerator_location

argument.name: extra_refrigerator_rated_annual_kwh
argument.description: The EnergyGuide rated annual energy consumption for an extra refrigerator. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Refrigerators) is used.

argument.name: extra_refrigerator_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the extra refrigerator energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Refrigerators) is used.

argument.name: freezer_location
argument.description: The space type for the freezer location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Freezers) is used.

argument.name: freezer_rated_annual_kwh
argument.description: The EnergyGuide rated annual energy consumption for a freezer. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Freezers) is used.

argument.name: freezer_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the freezer energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Freezers) is used.

argument.name: cooking_range_oven_present
argument.description: Whether there is a cooking range/oven present.

argument.name: cooking_range_oven_location
argument.description: The space type for the cooking range/oven location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Cooking Range/Oven) is used.

argument.name: cooking_range_oven_fuel_type
argument.description: Type of fuel used by the cooking range/oven.

argument.name: cooking_range_oven_is_induction
argument.description: Whether the cooking range is induction. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Cooking Range/Oven) is used.

argument.name: cooking_range_oven_is_convection
argument.description: Whether the oven is convection. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Cooking Range/Oven) is used.

argument.name: cooking_range_oven_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the cooking range/oven energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Cooking Range/Oven) is used.

argument.name: ceiling_fan_present
argument.description: Whether there are any ceiling fans.

argument.name: ceiling_fan_label_energy_use
argument.description: The label average energy use of the ceiling fan(s). If neither Efficiency nor Label Energy Use provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Ceiling Fans) is used.

argument.name: ceiling_fan_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency rating of the ceiling fan(s) at medium speed. Only used if Label Energy Use not provided. If neither Efficiency nor Label Energy Use provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Ceiling Fans) is used.

argument.name: ceiling_fan_quantity
argument.description: Total number of ceiling fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Ceiling Fans) is used.

argument.name: ceiling_fan_cooling_setpoint_temp_offset
argument.display_name: Ceiling Fan: Cooling Setpoint Temperature Offset
argument.description: The cooling setpoint temperature offset during months when the ceiling fans are operating. Only applies if ceiling fan quantity is greater than zero. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Ceiling Fans) is used.

argument.name: misc_plug_loads_television_present
argument.description: Whether there are televisions.

argument.name: misc_plug_loads_television_annual_kwh
argument.display_name: Misc Plug Loads: Television Annual kWh
argument.description: The annual energy consumption of the television plug loads. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Plug Loads) is used.

argument.name: misc_plug_loads_television_usage_multiplier

argument.name: misc_plug_loads_other_frac_sensible

argument.description: Multiplier on the well pump energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Plug Loads) is used.

argument.description: Multiplier on the fuel loads grill energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Fuel Loads) is used.

argument.name: misc_fuel_loads_lighting_annual_therm
argument.display_name: Misc Fuel Loads: Lighting Annual therm

argument.description: Multiplier on the fuel loads lighting energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Fuel Loads) is used.

argument.description: Multiplier on the fuel loads fireplace energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Fuel Loads) is used.

argument.name: pool_present

argument.description: The annual energy consumption of the pool pump. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Pool Pump) is used.

argument.name: pool_pump_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the pool pump energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Pool Pump) is used.

argument.name: pool_heater_type
argument.description: The type of pool heater. Use 'none' if there is no pool heater.

argument.name: pool_heater_annual_kwh
argument.description: The annual energy consumption of the electric resistance pool heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Pool Heater) is used.

argument.name: permanent_spa_heater_usage_multiplier

argument.name: emissions_scenario_names
argument.description: Names of emissions scenarios. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. If not provided, no emissions scenarios are calculated.

argument.name: emissions_types
argument.description: Types of emissions (e.g., CO2e, NOx, etc.). If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_units
argument.description: Electricity emissions factors units. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. Only lb/MWh and kg/MWh are allowed.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_values_or_filepaths
argument.display_name: Emissions: Electricity Values or File Paths
argument.description: Electricity emissions factors values, specified as either an annual factor or an absolute/relative path to a file with hourly factors. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_number_of_header_rows
argument.display_name: Emissions: Electricity Files Number of Header Rows
argument.description: The number of header rows in the electricity emissions factor file. Only applies when an electricity filepath is used. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_column_numbers
argument.description: The column number in the electricity emissions factor file. Only applies when an electricity filepath is used. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_fossil_fuel_units
argument.description: Fossil fuel emissions factors units. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. Only lb/MBtu and kg/MBtu are allowed.

argument.name: emissions_natural_gas_values
argument.description: Natural gas emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_propane_values
argument.description: Propane emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_fuel_oil_values
argument.description: Fuel oil emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_coal_values
argument.description: Coal emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_wood_values
argument.description: Wood emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_wood_pellets_values
argument.description: Wood pellets emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_scenario_names
argument.description: Names of utility bill scenarios. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. If not provided, no utility bills scenarios are calculated.

argument.name: utility_bill_electricity_filepaths
argument.description: Electricity tariff file specified as an absolute/relative path to a file with utility rate structure information. Tariff file must be formatted to OpenEI API version 7. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_electricity_fixed_charges
argument.description: Electricity utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_natural_gas_fixed_charges
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Natural Gas Fixed Charges
argument.description: Natural gas utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_propane_fixed_charges
argument.description: Propane utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_fuel_oil_fixed_charges
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Fuel Oil Fixed Charges
argument.description: Fuel oil utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_coal_fixed_charges
argument.description: Coal utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_wood_fixed_charges
argument.description: Wood utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_wood_pellets_fixed_charges
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Wood Pellets Fixed Charges
argument.description: Wood pellets utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_electricity_marginal_rates
argument.description: Electricity utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_natural_gas_marginal_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Natural Gas Marginal Rates
argument.description: Natural gas utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_propane_marginal_rates
argument.description: Propane utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_fuel_oil_marginal_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Fuel Oil Marginal Rates
argument.description: Fuel oil utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_coal_marginal_rates
argument.description: Coal utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_wood_marginal_rates
argument.description: Wood utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_wood_pellets_marginal_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Wood Pellets Marginal Rates
argument.description: Wood pellets utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_compensation_types
argument.description: Utility bill PV compensation types. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_net_metering_annual_excess_sellback_rate_types
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Net Metering Annual Excess Sellback Rate Types
argument.description: Utility bill PV net metering annual excess sellback rate types. Only applies if the PV compensation type is 'NetMetering'. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_net_metering_annual_excess_sellback_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Net Metering Annual Excess Sellback Rates
argument.description: Utility bill PV net metering annual excess sellback rates. Only applies if the PV compensation type is 'NetMetering' and the PV annual excess sellback rate type is 'User-Specified'. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_feed_in_tariff_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Feed-In Tariff Rates
argument.description: Utility bill PV annual full/gross feed-in tariff rates. Only applies if the PV compensation type is 'FeedInTariff'. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_monthly_grid_connection_fee_units
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Monthly Grid Connection Fee Units
argument.description: Utility bill PV monthly grid connection fee units. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_monthly_grid_connection_fees
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Monthly Grid Connection Fees
argument.description: Utility bill PV monthly grid connection fees. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: additional_properties
argument.description: Additional properties specified as key-value pairs (i.e., key=value). If multiple additional properties, use a |-separated list. For example, 'LowIncome=false|Remodeled|Description=2-story home in Denver'. These properties will be stored in the HPXML file under /HPXML/SoftwareInfo/extension/AdditionalProperties.

argument.name: combine_like_surfaces
argument.description: If true, combines like surfaces to simplify the HPXML file generated.

argument.name: apply_defaults
argument.description: If true, applies OS-HPXML default values to the HPXML output file. Setting to true will also force validation of the HPXML output file before applying OS-HPXML default values.

argument.name: apply_validation
argument.description: If true, validates the HPXML output file. Set to false for faster performance. Note that validation is not needed if the HPXML file will be validated downstream (e.g., via the HPXMLtoOpenStudio measure).
